google_play_reviews.content: I just love this app and it's easy to use

The video transcoding is great, but it's a terrible app to use. The interface to find a video file to load has no thumbnail, filtering or ability to sort. A few useful features like that and it'd easily be a 5 star app

Thanks for the free app. It would be awesome if the user was able to choose what audio and subtitle tracks to keep with the output, instead of automatically keeping the ones with foreign language; it would be good to have at least a select all option to check for this subject. When the screen goes off the app pause the process and just continues when turning screen on again, it would be great if you fix this issue; this happens while the app isn't in system power optimization plan black list.

Very bad visually and becuse of we cant select video from gallery it would be hard to find the video in storage specially when it doesnt have preview plus it takes two hours to compress and finally gave me the same size of that video !

Given 4 stars because it does the job it's meant to do,but until you improve the shockingly slow conversion speed you won't get the 5 stars. Over 3.5 hrs to transcode a 1.1gb file....really??... starting to think it should be 3 stars.
Fantastic. Exactly what I needed. I love that this frontend to ffmpeg exists. I use it frequently for sending large videos via Discord.
BEST APP WITH THE BASIC REQUIRED FEATURES.

Works but would like to see more encoder options, wanted to encode some music videos into mp3 audio, and it does that but apparently only in old school cbr mode, would like to see abr and vbr options as well as more channel modes, dual mono \ joint stereo.. not sure what im getting currently. Ability to extract av steams would be nice also. I'd also like the option of choosing the output location Still a good app for quick and dirty transcoding on your phone

works as expected, open a compatible video, set prefs and encode. lacks features but its free and does its job and a phone might not be the best option working with large videos anyway. Thanks for the app =D

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Yep, you are right, my mistake. A new release is available in beta now (v0.12.1) which addresses this. Thanks for reporting it.

google_play_reviews.content: Didn't work.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Can you provide some details as to what did not work? Feel free to send me an email.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app, doesn't even require a PC todo all that!
brilliant app üëè

It works super good for trimming, and encodes back to the original 
resoltion. I'm happy to see that it's under the GPL. Is there ever gonna be 
support for joining/merging videos together?

Glad to see custom resolutions added into the app to work around the video 
orientation issue. It is not a perfect solution indeed. Apart from that, 
not being able to view the thumbnails when choosing a video is making the 
job harder. Hopefully you can add thumbnails support in the future.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the suggestion. The next release will have the option to set a custom resolution. When that comes out let me know any feedback you may have. Feel free to send me an email.

google_play_reviews.content:
It works well for me right now. The custom resolution can be used to handle 
the "rotation metadata" of vertical videos temporarily. Though it's not a 
perfect solution, but honestly, it just works! Thank you. :)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad that you have a work-around for now for the rotation metadata issue using the custom resolution feature.. I still have the original issue logged to look at in the future.

google_play_reviews.content:
Excellent. Does what it says. Elegant UI. Edit: Thanks for supporting audio 
formats as well
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the suggestion. Release v0.5 supports selecting audio formats. If you have any other comments, feel free to send me an email.

google_play_reviews.content:
Did not work on Zuk z2131 running Android 8.1, force closed when I tired to 
convert.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I was able to determine what was missing for Android 8.1 support. A fix will be in the next release, which will be v0.9.

google_play_reviews.content: Two things I miss: 1) a lossless remuxing / copy mode (in FFMPEG: "-c:v copy", "-c:a copy"). 2) a setting to set the save path instead of always being in /Movies by default.
